title: New Orleans Jazz National Historical Park: Operating Hours & Seasons
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Basic Information     Operating Hours & Seasons              Operating Hours & Seasons      Please note our new reduced hours of operation Visitor Center      (916 N. Peters Street)  *****Closed for Renovations***** 9:00 a.m. - 5:00 p.m. Tuesday through Saturday.  The park is closed on Mardi Gras (Fat Tuesday) and all Federal Holidays. Old U. S. Mint       (400 Esplanade Avenue) Operating Hours on Tuesday, Wednesday, and Thursday are from 10:00 a.m. to 4:30 p.m.Operating Hours on Friday and Saturday are from 10:00 a.m. - 4:00 p.m. The Mint is closed during all state holidays. The jazz exhibit at the Mint, part of the Louisiana State Museum, is open Tuesday through Saturday from 10:00 a.m. - 4:30 p.m. For information about evening shows at the Mint sponsored by the Louisiana State Museum, visit www.musicatthemint.org Perseverance Hall     (Louis Armstrong Park) Now open for special events only.  Headquarters, 419 Decatur Street: Tuesday - Saturday 9:00 a.m. - 4:30 p.m. The Park is closed on all Federal Holidays.  Seasons The park is open year-round.  Several times a year the park participates in special events that bring enhanced opportunities to experience the city's jazz culture.  April is Jazz Appreciation Month which includes French Quarter Festival and the New Orleans Jazz and Heritage Festival.  In August the park hosts the Children's Stage at Satchmo SummerFest.  October is Jazz Awareness Month and the park boasts seasonal concerts for December's Christmas New Orleans Style.
